subject: Re: Audio files from my impact point ITC sessions
author: M.A. Coletta (Mike)
full_text:
Yes, Misty is correct.  They are my files from the crash impact 
point. These are the only files I captured there.
Each session is represented by three files..
(1) the raw capture.. 
(2)the raw capture with noise removed and slight amplification... 
(3)processed file using echo/frequency additions stimulated by file 
(2).
This way others can listen or use any of the file variations for 
their own research.
I'll be adding files from sessions at the gravesites and lab using 
crash debris next week.
I used mostly the processed files in the video.  By linking all the 
files on my website, I provide others an avenue to listen and use all 
of them.

RJ says he hears only noise...

Noise in a certain patterns could be taken as a word or words. 
Myself, I hear certain patterns of noise in portions of some of the 
files.  Are they words or phrases?  Could be.  Is what I think I 
heard relivent to this event (a crash)?
Yes... So, I believe I have captured something related to this event 
with at least a portion of my ITC session.

I've read and heard that not everyone always hears the same thing... 
but it doesn't mean something is not there.

- Mike C. (UFO Geek)

--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "Misty" <bulletbabea@...> wrote:
>
> I think those are his own files he recorded either near the source 
of 
> impact or using debris. He is just sharing as he goes. Giving the 
raw 
> audio for those who would rather have that than the processed or 
> denoised files. Interesting sounds tho. 
> 
> Misty
> 
> - In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, Rj <rasterer@> wrote:
> >
> > 
> > On going through them all, I think I see now that you did not 
post 
> 12 samples. You posted perhaps four, with 2 or 3 duplicates as 
> they've been variously processed. Is this the case? The 
processing 
> to me sounds like audio-cleanup processing, based on the amount of 
> audio pixelation it seems to have introduced, some rather severe? 
> > 
> > However, I didn't hear anything in any of these other than 
noise. 
> Is there anything particular you wanted to highlight? Were you 
> looking for any input?
> > 
> >
